required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influences of Phenylephrine, Dopamine and Ephedrine on Stroke Volume Variation and Pulse Pressure Variation
clinical_study.official_title: Influences of Phenylephrine, Dopamine and Ephedrine on Stroke Volume Variation and Pulse Pressure Variation

brief_summary.textblock: Although induced hypertension decreased SVV and PPV,the influences of stroke volume variation and pulse pressure variation caused by phenylephrine,dopamine and ephedrine were unknown.

detailed_description.textblock: Pulse pressure variation (PPV) and stroke volume variation (SVV) during mechanical ventilation have been shown to be effective parameters to predict preload responsiveness. Although induced hypertension decreases PPV and SVV, the influences of phenylephrine, dopamine and ephedrine on PPV and SVV are unknown.

primary_outcome.measure: invasive arterial blood pressure as a Measure of Safety
primary_outcome.description: if instability of circulation, stop the clinical trial

arm_group.arm_group_label: phenylephrine group, dopamine group, ephedrine group
arm_group.description: phenylephrine group: use the phenylephrine to increase the SAP from low to high level. dopamine group: use the dopamine to increase the SAP from low to high level. ephedrine group:use the ephedrine to increase the SAP from low to high level.

intervention.intervention_name: Influences of phenylephrine, dopamine and ephedrine on stroke volume variation and pulse pressure variation
intervention.description: This research mainly study the effect of clinical commonly used vasoconstrictor drugs on blood pressure of pressure
intervention.arm_group_label: phenylephrine group, dopamine group, ephedrine group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Their American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status was 1 or 2
- Body mass index (BMI) ranged from 18 to 26
- None of the patients had known diabetes mellitus, hypertension, cardiovascular, pulmonary, endocrinological, neurological diseases, or diseases that influenced intravascular fluid volume or balance
- All patients had a preoperative fast for at least 8 h and routine atropine intramuscular injection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Persistent arrhythmias
- Intraoperative application of vasoactive drugs except phenylephrine, dopamine and ephedrine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Anesthesiology, People's Liberation Army General Hospital, Beijing, China
